Argentina: The Battle of Cepeda took place between Unitarians who supported a strong centralised state, and Federals, largely provincial caudillo warlords who wanted decentralised authority. The Federals won and the February 1820 Treaty of Pilar declared Argentina as a federal country, although Unitarian ideals continued
Cambodia: A Khmer revolt took place against Vietnamese rule .
Chile: Valdivia is captured by Lord Cochrane who commands the Chilean navy. The Freedom Expedition of Perú is organised by the government of Chile, and manages to free some parts of Peru from Spanish rule.
China:
The Jiaqing Emperor died.
The Jiaqing Emperor's son the Daoguang Emperor became emperor of the Qing dynasty.
Haiti:
Christophe, King of the northern Haitian state, commits suicide
Boyer promulgates the Republican Constitution in Christophe's northern state; northern and southern Haiti are unified
Peru: An Argentine army led by José de San Martín landed at Paracas.
Poland: Kraków Town Hall was demolished excluding the tower.
Tonga: Aleamotu'a took the throne as Tu'i Kanokupolu amidst ongoing conflict.
